reviews.review_msg: He is just amazing. I failed Ochem the first time I took it cause I didn't want to go to the lecture cause the topics are so dry. Nabyl makes the class engaging and bearable. Go to class regularly, attend tutorials, practice on your own, and go to his office hours if you have questions and you should do just fine!
The best prof I've ever had. :D I LOVE O-Chem now.

She is an extremely capable prof. I really enjoyed her lectures and she is actually a very nice person. Knowing CHEM 281 is important for this course. So if you get her you will be fine. She is really good. :) Good Luck!

I'm a second year chemistry student with a 3.9 CGPA overall and I got 35% on the first midterm. It is THE hardest exam I've ever written plus he literally doesn't teach anything with the "flip classroom model". Not gonna take his online class ever ever ever again. Avoid at all cost.

Always encourages questions. Doesn't matter if it's directly related to what he's teaching. He asks if you understand concepts (from previous classes) and if not, he explains them. He wants his students to succeed and if you take the time to go talk to him, he will help you improve your learning. You still have to put in the effort to learn concept

Most people dislike Dr.Bennet's teaching style, but I personally found him alright. He's a nice guy, answers questions and replies to emails within a day which was quite helpful.  He puts a lot of questions from practice exams and iClicker questions in the actual exams, so as long as you do the practice and understand it you should be fine :)

Pete is very friendly, respected and intelligent. I enjoyed his class. His exams were very challenging but fair as he helped where he could (bonus marks). Notes were very old school, but once you got used to them they were actually much better than modern notes. If you take the class tho, just conform to his methods of teaching and you'll be fine.

Dr. Wilson is an amazing prof! CHEM 282/83 is a difficult course and many students complained that he crams too much content into the last few weeks. DO NOT try and memorize everything, instead do the problem sets and understand and recognize similar patterns. Many students that didn't like this class were life sci majors who are used to memorizing

Makes no sense as you go but it'll be come together once you cram everything and then it's like “aahh I see what you want…k I'm cooked” You'll get used to the handwritten notes. Problem sets were tedious but helpful. EASY marker thank god. Fell asleep a few times in lec. Also he'll tell a joke, stop, face blank, stare into your soul n grin

I loved Pete! The course distribution was quite challenging since it was all exam-based, but they were fairly written. He also included bonus marks which helped A LOT. I found his lectures interesting and liked that he always encouraged questions. This class was difficult but still my favourite class I've ever taken!
Lecture notes are handwritten, but very clear / not endless. OCHEM 3 is HARD, but exams were always so fair, and Dr. Wilson is clearly so excited to talk about organic chemistry. So sweet.
Test based course for sure but Dr. Wilson are always passionate about helping you understand the materials.

Very caring prof. You can really tell he knows alot about chemistry and he tries to make lectures interesting.
Weekly problem sets really help, they are usually harder than the exam questions.
The final (283) was harder than the midterms but honestly very fair.

Dr. Pete is very passionate about chemistry. He give practice questions with the clear instructions about everything. 2nd midterm was way harder than the first one. Go to classes and understand the material, you will do great!!!

First time teaching 282/283 and you couldn't tell, very good at explaining the concepts and the man put countless hours into his notes for that semester. Office hours are a key to success too, he rambles so you end up learning a lot more than you came for

Dr.Merbouh is a great prof for ochem. Teaches material in a clear way AND goes into real-life applications - which makes lectures  useful and fun/funny. He really likes it when the class participates and he teaches best in an active class. Ochem isn't easy by any means so the more you practice the better you do.

Very engaging professor who actually cares about his students individually as well, however lecture attendance is mandatory in order to understand his slides and take notes. Participation is not mandatory but he loves it lol

Whoever is rating four out of four youre a TA in disguise, Yeah this guy is super smart but he's also been teaching this for 30+ years. Be ready to hundred percent learn this class on your own. He was exciting and fun the first bit of the semester but then his mood just went down. Not approachable at all especially after he lost it on the class

Nabyl really knows how to teach organic chemistry. Looking purely from a teaching perspective, he is one of the best profs at SFU. However he can be very intense. Some might see it as caring and some might not. If you get frightened easily then don't take this class with him

When I was taking this class with him it was a huge mess, as the notes were all over the place and when the class shifted to remote learning it was even worse. Overall, I would suggest watching youtube videos to better understand the content.

Dr. Merbouh is a truly amazing lecturer but be prepared for call and response lectures and getting comfortable with shouting out answers and asking questions. Go to his office hours- he will take the time to help you understand. His teaching style is awesome but stay on top of tutorials and lecture notes! Wouldn't take OChem with anyone else.

Nabyl was awesome! My favourite thing about him is that he is encourages the students to learn. He can pick on you for being on your phone but he really just wants you to listen and do well! Very understanding and absolutely hilarious!

Nabyl is an outstanding prof! I really enjoy being in his lectures, as he makes organic chemistry less painful. He really cares about his students and how they understand the materials. I would rate Dr. Merbouh 12 out 10 if I could. (Also shoutout to Ali (one of the ochem TAs), he really made me understand the hardest concepts very easily)
